New Records: This will be the first meeting between the two sides in any format of the game.
Key Match Events: A win for England will bolster their chances for a spot in the semis, while a loss could bring it down to a net run rate battle.
Pre-Game Insights: England have not made too many changes to their playing XI during the tournament and are likely to field the side that played against South Africa.
USA will still be without their injured regular captain Monank Patel and Shayan Jahangir could get yet another run in the side.
Jos Buttler’s side narrowly lost to South Africa in their second Super Eight game after beating hosts West Indies comfortably in the first one.
Aaron Jones, USA’s stand-in captain, believes his side have made inroads into American fans’ hearts and their performance will help build the game in the baseball-loving nation.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kensington Oval pitch has been one of the few high-scoring surfaces in the Caribbean during this tournament, but has offered ample support to both pace and spin bowlers.
The weather in Bridgetown will remain hot and humid all day, with a chance of a thunderstorm and brief showers shortly before the match.
Others: This was the 100th meeting between the two teams.

England seemed to have brushed off their group-stage loss against Australia with three straight wins over Oman, Namibia and West Indies, but they fell short against South Africa in their second group game.
